p: A schematic illustration of constituent analysis and behavioral evaluations of Cinnamomum osmophloeum ct. linalool leaf oil is shown in Figure 1. According to gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS) analyses ( Figure 2), the main component of the selected C. osmophloeum leaf oil was linalool (93.2%), followed by coumarin (2.3%), camphor (1.5%), Î²-caryophyllene (1.2%), trans-cinnamaldehyde (1.0%), and caryophyllene oxide (0.8%) ( Table 1). The content of the major compound, linalool, was more than 90%; it revealed that the quality and stability of leaf oils from C. osmophloeum ct. linalool are consistent.
